one another maketh v verye chriſtian menne menne ſo eagerlye ſtryue eche one wyth ſo one chriſtian manne aſhamed call another lawe accuſe hym beefore wicked iudge thynke ye iudge looke hereupon wyll thys wyſe thynke wyth themſelfe among theſe chriſtians ſhamefaſteneſſe become brotherlye charitie peace ſomuche ſpeake communitie poſſeſſion theyr deſpiſyng ryches myldeneſſe goſpell commaunded euen gladly forgoe theyr coate alſo yf haue taken away theyr cloke behold ſhamefully ſmal matter thei ſtriue wt v alſo among thēſelfes cōmeth ye corinthian y• ye yet ſomuch ſet money y• theſame ye haue ſo greatly defamed chriſtian name religion ſome one wil anſwer ſay onles proſecute y• matter laboure righte ſure take wrong onleſſe recouer myne owne title ſhalbee loſyng ſyde woulde aduyſe take hede leſte while ye feare ſmall loſſe money ye appayre innocencie good name cauſe alſo goſpell bee hindered better neuer winne youre goodes recouerye geue vn beleuers occaſion myſreporte ſpeake euil chriſt better paſſe vpon ſmal wrong while thou laboureſt thy right openlye declare thou haſte mynde deſirouſe reuenge nowe truely ſo farre ye lyke mylde chriſtian men without reuenging ſuffre loſſe iniurye euen wilfully ye dooe wrong maliciouſlye deceaue oppreſſe onely vnbeleiuers alſo ſuch religion brother sauer ſuche doinges leauen olde life square ſuche pointes far learnyng profeſſion whoſoeuer hys power suche haue nowe reherſed ſome ye throughe chriſt borne agayne laye charge ye beefore ſo ye fall nomore thereto waſhed ye deliuered youre olde ſynnes goddes free gyfte beeware ye bee nomore defiled wyth thē waſhyng hath god bloud reſtored innocente hurtleſſe lyfe geuen alſo holineſſe righteouſnes power law youre deſertes ieſus chriſte whoſe name ye baptiſed ſpirite oure god whoſe ſecrete inſpiraciō ſacramētes chriſtes churche effectual much ſhould euery endeuour leſt ye yourei maie • thing al thinges profitable owne folye loſe benefite frelye geuen vnto ſo doyng neyther thankfull geuer yet frendelye louyng ſelfe ſuche thynges appertayne naturall neceſſities maye dooe thynges man forbyddeth vſe lyke authoritie apoſtles vſe paraduenture alwayes profitable vſe ryght suche fedde liue wyth youre meate ſuche pyll polle beeyng euen bondſlaues bought wyth moneye dare freely warne youre faultes leſte ye vpon dyſpleaſure conceaued wyth beſtowe liberalitie otherwyſe myght alſo labour take rewarde namely ſince tooke paynes anye wanted authoritie dooe woulde dooe thyng whereby myghte bee brought vnder mānes power ſubieccion ſeame bounde thyntente myghte clearely appeare bothe yf teache anye thyng therein ſeeke weale profite myne owne alſo yf dydde woordes anye thynge chaſtice ye ſhoulde pacientely heare thyng commenlye ſeene ſuche mannes free ſpeache offendeth whiche nothyng bounde hym whome reproueth elles litell mattier maketh whoſe meate manne eate ſynce menne muſte needes haue meate ſynce meates ordayned bealye likewyſe bealyes meates lette euery manne tyme ſatiſfye preſente neceſſitye neede wythin ſhorte tyme wyll god deſtroye bothe bealye meate whiche neyther oure bealyes ſhall wyth houngre trouble v meates ſhall bee anye vſe whiche haue profeſſed chriſte muſte obeye ſerue naturall lackes euen heathen vnchriſtened dooe ſo ſhoulde yet betwene v vyce bee none agremente meates forbydde none lette euerye manne eare wyll butlet bodye bee applied vnto fornicacion filthye bodily luſte forbydde lyke bealye appoynted meate ſoe bodye prepared carnall pleaſure rather oure bodye conſecrate vnto lorde ieſu agayne coupled vnto v ſo hath pleaſed hym v member hym heade hys ſpirituall miſticall bodye ſhoulde bee made kyntte together knotte holdeth litell ſeaſon deathe deede taketh awaye neceſſitie meates breaketh knotte wherewyth ioyned chriſte godde father rayſed lorde ieſus oure heade deathe ſo wyll likewyſe rayſe vppe agayne v membres wyth hym rewarde v life euerlaſting hable power dooe albeit ſome thynke ſame vnlykelye therefore oure ſoule ſhall immortall lyfe bee partaker onleſſe ſame preſente tyme throughe godlye continuall meditacions haue hadde theſame lyfe delygente remembraunce ſo bodye rayſed agayne ſhall glorye haue parte onleſſe theſame preſente tyme haue beene free contagion ſynne foule ſyght yf member ſeame vnlyke heade whiche euery pointe pure cleane texte eyther konwe ye bodyes membres chriſte ſhall nowe take member chriſte make member harlot god forbid ye know whiche coupleth hymſelfe harlot become one body two ſaieth ſhal bee one fleſh ioyned vnto lord one ſpirite remembre ye tolde bodyes member chriſte sal nowe become ſo mad notwithſtandyng know much great reproche head take away membre chriſte make thereof membre harlote god forbidde yet elles dooth whiche conuerſaunte harlote knowe ye playne poynte whiche coupleth hymſelfe harlote becommeth ſame one bodye ſo reade geneſis manne wyfe bothe ſhall one fleſhe one bodye bee made lawefull matrimonye honeſte godlye conſente two myndes makethe one lawefull acte matrimonye betwixte two maketh one ſo vnlawefull coumpainying together euery manne beecommeth wherwyth filthylye coupled greate enormitie therefore womanne deceauyng houſebande ſhould aduouterer bee conuerſaunte foule acte bodye whiche conſecrate chriſte ſhoulde bee coupled vyle harlote whiche coupled vnto lorde ieſu reaſon commen conſente betwyxte head bodye hym made one ſpirite whiche foraſmuche moſte pure cleane fylthye fleaſhelye luſte moſte contrarye whiche manne taketh awaye vſe reaſon alteryng hym brutiſhe beaſtelye condicion texte ¶ fle fornicacion euery ſinne manne doth withoute bodye fornicatour ſinneth againſte owne bodye either knowe ye howe youre body temple holy ghoſte whiche dwelleth whome ye haue god howe ye youre owne ye derely bought therefore glorifie god body ſpirites whiche goddes dyligentelye therefore flee fornicacion ſynnes ſynfull perſones wrought done albeeit haue theyr beginnyng body ſeame yet ioyned harme dyſpleaſure mannes bodye pollute ſeamethe whole manne ſuche committeth fornicacion doothe wrong vilanie owne bodye foule acte abuſeth defileth adulterer defileth hores body except alſo defile withoute offence committed mannequeller ſwerde kylleth another without hurte body hurteth another man ſeameth one part polluted fornicacion defileth whole body euē cōmen ſorte wel vnderſtandeth ſuche acte theſame woone vſe bathe therwith waſhe away ſuch filthines therby conceiued hainouſe offēce wrong hurt another man body māto bodye vilainouſe reprocheful ſemeth apointe extreme madnes albeit fornicacion moſt ſpecially defile body yet thynke therfore y• offence ſmal euē body ſhould alſo haue honour foraſmuch māſiō ſoule whiche immortal cleanſed wt holy water baptiſme ſuche ſorte conſecrate god beecommeth temple holye ghoſte whiche ye baptiſme receyued whereby ye ſo ioyned vnto chriſte ye hym ſhall neuer bee ſoondred fornicacion owne reproche hurte nothyng moue yet lette moue ſuche actes canne bee one without greate iniurie chriſte ye whoſe bodye ye coupled ioyned hath deathe boughte made owne ye ſhoulde ſeruauntes owne men right title bodye bought byers hande theſame whoſo eyther ſelleth handeleth otherwyſe owner dothe wrong hym whome theſame bodye beelongethfor ye dearely boughte bee ſuppoſed chriſte litell boughte v oure redempcion ſpente moſte precious bloude wherefore ſynce ye god wholye conſecrated defile reproche hym youre body beare aboute aſwell chaſte body vnhurtefull myndes holye ghoſte among menne auaunce glorie bothe keape chaſte leſte filthines ſake among eiuil people chriſt whoſe name ye profeſſe bee eyuill ſpoken nobilitee maiſters belongeth euen ſeruauntes ſo diſhoneſtie ſeruauntes theyr maiſters reprochfull wherefore albeeit god bee neyther prayſe made glorious reproche defamed dede yet ſorte naughtye ſeruauntes diſhonoured godly maners holy life glorified while among commen ſorte lyfe eſteamed vii chapter texte concernyng thinges wherof ye wrote vnto good man touch woman neuertheleſſe auoyde whordome let euerye man haue wife let euery woman haue huſbande let huſband geue vnto wyſe due beneuolence likewyſe alſo wyfe vnto huſband wife hath power owne body huſband likewiſe huſbande hath power owne body wyfe withdrawe ſelues one another except conſente tyme geue ſelues faſtyng prayer afterwarde come gether agayne left satan tempte youre incontinencye ſaye fauoure commaundement woulde men ſelfe euery man hath proper gyfte god one thys maner another ſaye vnto vnmaryed wyddowes good yf abyde euen yf cannot abſteyne let marye • better mary burne vnto maryed commaunde lorde let wyfe ſeperated frō huſbande ſhe ſeparate ſelfe let remayn vnmaryed reconciled vnto huſband agayne let huſband put awaye hys wyfe hym haue muche ſayed becauſe thinke euery acte generacion defileth bodye ſome laboure bring mynde intente lyke hypocrite maye bee thoughte bee holye matrimonye certayne chaſte lawefull vſe vnlawefull acte muſte generallye menne bee auoyded lawefull matrimonie muſte euerye manne ſo farfurth vſe vſe preferment goſpell expediente wherefore touchyng queſtions wherein letter ye aſke myne aduyce theſe ſhall briefly anſwere fyrſte ſuche muſte doe already maryed ought doe ſingle widowes alſo muſte doe whiche eyther paynefull vnequall matrimony troubled finally ſhould bee done virgin maried maried fyrſte therefore many cauſes time requireth wer well doen men wholy cauſe abſteyne theyr wyues maye freedome applye chriſtes goſpell godly lyfe albeit matrimonie holy thyng yet wrappeth man worldlye care wherein howe muche laboure beſtowed ſomuche leſſe god ſerued beſyde vſe matrimonye hath groſſe thyng whiche tyme ſwaloweth vppe deuoureth whole man whiche beeyng reſtored hymſelfe ſomewhat leſſe man well ſee ſpecially wiſhed yet dare ſo muche exacte would deſire leſte while ye vnluckely labour towarde beſte occaſion fall worſe knowe howe vnruly violente fleaſhelye deſyre aslet euery man haue owne wife ſure howe ye ſpecially among prone muche geuen vnto ſurer waye therefore thynke euery man haue owne wyfe euerye wife houſebande mutuall ſeruice eche one maye remeadye others intemperancie albeeit elswiſe pointes houſebandes authoritie yet herein haue bothe equal power neither houſebād ſo farfurth lorde maiſter owne bodye touchyng vſe matrimonie defraude wyfe thereof geue another right wyues bodye agayne concerninge vſe matrimonie ſuch ſorte owne ſhe maye denye huſband vſe therof geue another hyr bodye huſbandes ryghte debte eche towardes lyke tyme requireth muſt party delyuered payed haue made promiſe let houſebande geue law mariage bounden geue wife wife likewyſe geue houſebande ſhe lawe wedlocke bounde geue eche one lyke ſorte bounde poyntes paraduenture whole gouernaunce autoritye houſebandes handes denye right yf eyther bothe aſke defraudyng onelye ſuche defraude whiche paye money bounde paye ſuche alſo refuſe doe bound doe let neither therfore loue chaſtitye defraude excepte bee conſente bothe towythdrawe ſelfes one frō another excepte conſent time abſteine ſeaſon ye maye cleane myndes geue ſelfes faſting holye prayer remembraunce heauenlye thinges whoſe perfeite freaſhnes ſuche carnall conuerſacion greatly woonte make dulle let either bothe therefore neither abſteyne comen conſente vpon euerye flyght occaſion loue heauenlye thynges long neither certayne tyme ſo returne agayne olde cuſtome becauſe thinke beſte lyue continuall prayer becauſe knowe ieopardy leſte satan ſtyll lieth watche deſtroye perceauyng toward diſpoſicion incontinencie occaſion thereof prouoke worſe rather haue whiche leſſe perfeccion ſo bee ieoperdleſſe whiche muche commendable beeyng yet ſuche ioyned ſmall perill yet ſpeake becauſe woulde either compell man marie forbyd man lyue continually chaſte able ſo mutuall cō ſente matrimonie prouyde vpon knowledge haue youre weakenes remeadye agaynſte perilles yf yf might woulde wyſhe men ſelfe whiche free bonde matrimonye el vſed theyr wyues theyr ſiſters lyuyng purenes chaſtitie dare exacte thyng whiche chriſte neuer required diſciples hearer bleſſed ſaith loue kingdom god haue made themſelues chaſte yet refuſeth ſuche chaſtlye ſoberly liue vnder lawe matrimonie continuall chaſtitie taken vpon anye man auauncement chriſtes affayres highe thing ſo lawfull matrimonie honeſte ſtate whoſe chiefe ordeyner halower waseuery man hathe proper gift god god hymſelfe betwene bodyes ſoules meruaylous great difference goddes gyftes euerye manne lyke peraduenture thyng aboue mannes power wholye abſtayne acte matrimonie bleſſed whome god hath gyuen ſuche ſtrength god people hath loued varietie ſome gyftes ſhoulde excelle whiche varietie ſhoulde wonderfullye make towarde ſwete armonie comlynes whole lette manne therfore reproue another mannes ſtate ſorye owne let euerye manne accordyng power godlye vſe gyfte whiche god hath geuen hym chaſte wedlocke vnchaſte virginitie haue ye counſel touchyng marying kepyng youre wyues nowe vnderſtande mynde lykewyſe touchyng youre queſtion ſeconde mariages among heare ſome whiche albeit denye ye fredome maye marrye yet one deathe made free woulde haue marrye agayne theſe doubtes thinke yf manne reaſon death wyfe become ſingle yf anye womanne reaſon huſbandes death wydowe well doen able thencefurth lyue chaſte yf neither ſeeke wyfe ſhe another huſbande bothe dedicate theyr freedome vnto goddes ſeruice haue myne owne parte choſen whiche thoughte beſte becauſe nothing ſhoulde lette preachyng god worde whiche ſo hartely fauoure loue thereof litle ſet ſuche pleaſures marriage nowe yf knewe menne theſame mynde woulde lette call exhorte euery manne doe doe ſynce diſpoſicions mennes myndes bodyes ſo vnlyke vnmeete gyue menne one kynde counſell rather lette euerye manneif cannot abſtayne lette thē marry better marry burne weyghe owne ſtrengthe ſo folowe kynde lyfe whereunto nature thynketh hymſelfe mooſt meete lette ſuche one vpon profe matrimonie feeleth hymſelfe vnable reſiſte violente burnyng aſſaultes fleſhe rather marrye agayne lawfull matrimonie maye remedye vnchaſtnes lyuyng ſyngle vehemente deſyre fleſhe ieopardie grieuouſe offence neither compel men marie yet forbyd mariage leaue euery man fredome weyghe hymſelfe expediente nothyng haue herein preſcribe vnto taught vnto lorde require commaunded ieſus chriſte suche vnmaried ſtande free ſaye either marie marye iudge beſt ſo theyr doinges haue iye nothing chriſtes glorye man maried would haue done whiche among iewes gentile commonlye ſeene forlet wyfe ſeperated frō huſbād euerie ſmall matier diuorce made god hathe forbydden menne ſmall offence refuſe theyr wyues notwithſtandyng moſes poynte fauourably bare iewes becauſe thought good ſo doe fearyng leſte iewes beyng ſtubberne kynde people readye miſchiefe vpon deniall diuorces mighte happelye doe ſuche thynges muche wurſe anye diuorce one cauſe lorde hymſelfe excepted yf wyfe another commyt aduoutrie whiche thyng doeth either becauſe ſhe fallen righte wedlocke whiche promiſyng bodye one manne onelye hathe neuertheles departed vnto another el becauſe ſemeth vnreaſonable thyng conſtrayne manne haue one houſe one bedde one fyer one table common▪ whiche falſelye breakyng promyſe made mariage whiche nothing holy hath foule aduouterer abuſed bodye ſtrong ſtedfaſte woulde chriſte haue felowſhyppe bee vnleſſe therfore anye ſuche thyng chaunce let neither wyfe departe huſbande huſbande thruſte wyfe hym yf diſpleaſures debate aryſe meane whereof wyfe chaunceth departe huſbande leſte ſhe throughe owne folye ſtande without hope reconcilyng lette abyde vnmaried yf ſhe continewe vntouched vndefiled paraduenture huſbande beeyng better moode wyll contente receyue agayne corrupte womanne wyll receyue nowe yf womanne cannot ſo long refrayne ſelfe let diligentlye labour wynne huſbandes fauoure agayne yf ſhe huſbande cannot obtayne ſomuche lette aſſure whome ſoeuer ſhe couple herſelfe theſame knotte maye happely named mariage dede aduoutcie texte ¶ remnaunt ſpeake lorde brother haue wyfe beleueth • ſhe content dwell hym let hym put away woman hath huſbande infidell conſent dwell let put away vnbeleuyng huſband ſainctifyed wyfe vnbeleuyng wyfe ſancfied huſbande el chyldren vncleane holye yf vnbeleuyng departe let hym departe brother ſyſter ſubieccion ſuche god hath called v peace knoweſt thou woman whether thou ſhalt ſaue thy huſbande knoweſt thou man whether thou ſhalt ſaue thy wyfe no▪ euen god hath diſtributed euery man nowe touching queſtion vnequall mariage lordes authoritie nothing haue aunſwere yet haue thing myne opinion would counſel folowe waye profitable odiouſe acte diuorce would haue matrimony broken diuerſitie religion chaunce chriſtian woman maried huſbande yet chriſtened huſbande albeit ſtraunger miſteries chriſte yet ſo hatefull religion ſake refuſe yf wyfe wyll folowe counſell ſhe ſhal forſake likewiſe agayne yf chaūce huſbande beeyng chriſtian man haue wyfe ſuche one chriſte ſtraunger ſynce vnmete man compelled take religion vpon hym ſhe vpon diſpleaſure huſbandes cō trarie religiō ſeke diuorced councell huſband ſhall put awaye cauſe none chriſtian man chriſtian woman ſhould feare leſte familiar conuerſaciō one vnchriſtened eyther myght defiled withſtanding one religion vncleane yet mariage whereby beyng elſwiſe inequall coupled together good lawfull mariage wyckednes wurſe infecteth godlines better rather better effectuall greater weight infor vnbeleu • ng huſband • ſanctified wyfe c behalfe huſband therfore albeit heathen yet touchyng acte matrimony companye chriſtian woman made holy likewiſe wife whiche hath yet profeſſed chriſte conuerſacion chriſtian huſbande touchyng lawfull vſe matrimony made good holy yf ſo theyr child borne inceſtuouſly vnlawfull meanes ſhould coumpted prophane vncleane pure cleane child borne lawfull wedlocke well knowen true wyfe whiche baptiſed hath vnchriſtened huſband doe ſhe ſo doyng obeyeth huſband heathen ſuffereth ſhe wycked beareth hym ſhe truſteth wyll amende hope maye manne conceyue hym whiche although yet profeſſe chriſte yet wyfe abhorreth honouryng god throughly heathen rather partly chriſtian māne whiche quietly lyueth wyfe profeſſeth chriſtes name canne paciently bee contented ſee ſigne croſſe ouer theyr common bedde party doe continewe together ſuche diuerſitie religion deuided vpon hope therfore ought woman whiche fyrſte embraced chriſte abyde huſbande yf diuorce growe ſyde whiche yet beleueth theſame manne hate chriſtes name refuſe wyfe ſyncebut yf vnbeleuing depart let hym departe chaunge hope cauſe hathe wyfe lyue hym longer loſte hathe ryght tytle matrimonie whiche deſpiſeth god authour therof doeth promyſe made mariage ſo farfothe bynde chriſtened ſhe ſhall euer bee compelled ſuffre wycked huſbande brawlyng curſyng name chriſte let therfore vſe lybertie diuorce geuen vnto god thencefurth ſerue chriſte quietly therfore called god lyfe ghoſpell lyue ſedicion chyding lyue peace concorde therfore yf ſuche betwene whome vnequall mariage agree vnfaythfull require diuorced let chriſtian wyfe abyde huſbande againſt yf agree hope huſbande amende let wyfe continewe lykewyſe let huſbande continewe wyfe hope ſhe chaunged howe knoweſt thou art wyfe whether thou ſhalt familiar communicacion ſobre gentle behauiour wy • ely loue cauſe thy huſbande amende ſaued canſt thou know art huſbande whether thou ſhalt lyke wayes ſaue thy wyfe wynne chriſte yf eyther bothe ſo doe great gayne yf come paſſe yet wyll god approue thy good wyll whiche intendeſt ſuche thing meane ſeaſon whyles vncertayne whether wyll ſo let matrimonie vpon good hope continewe holde let diuerſitie religion chaunge ſtate lyfe neyther doeth baptiſme delyuer wyfe ryght huſbande yf vſe lawfully yet ſeruaunte dominion maiſter yf vſe hym ryght reaſon would texte lorde hath called euery man ſo let walke ſo ordeyne congregacions man called beyng circumciſed let hym adde vncircumciſion called vncircumciſed let circumciſed circumciſion nothyng vncircumcſyon nothyng keping commaundementes god let euery man abyde ſame callyng wherin called art thou called ſeruaunt care neuertheleſſe yf thou mayeſt fre vſe rather called lorde beyng ſeruaunt lordes freman lykewyſe called beyng fre chriſtes ſeruaunt ye dearly bought ye ſeruauntes men brother let euery manne wherin called therin abyde god lorde hath geuen euery man theſame let hym ſerue chriſte ſtate lyuing tyme preachyng ghoſpell manne founde let hym theſame continewe newe religion abolyſheth olde lyfe deſtroyeth olde ſtate lyfe becauſe chriſtian religion agreeth ſtandeth euery condicion lyfe geuen god trouble ciuile policie worlde entente euery degree ſtate lyfe euery manne myght lyue therin godly deuoutly councell whiche onely teache alſo congregacions ſhall paynfull folowe whiche euery manne foloweth wherfore yf inſpiracion god holy ſpirite calleth fynde maryed breake therefore thy matrimony fynde circumciſed without cauſe art thou thou ſhouldeſt loth thy condicion ſeke bee vncircumciſed nothyng eyther furdereth hyndereth vncircumciſion newe religion againe yf theſame fynde vncircumciſed cauſe haſte thou wyſhe circumciſed touching newe religion lytle force maketh whether thou circumciſed vncircumciſed ſortes egally belongeth eche lyue henceforth commaūdementes god whoſe rule haue profeſſed carnal deſyres moue sufficient chaunge thy old euil maners chaunge condiciō thy lyfe nothing neadeth becauſe ſuche thing cannot done without diſquietnes trouble haue ſayed ye ſhoulde doe called god ſtate matrimonie ſtate circumciſion euen lyke wyſe muſte ye iudge ſtate bondage suche preaching receuyng goſpell bonde let bee content theyr fortune thinke themſelues delyueryd theyr maiſters dominion becauſe delyuered tyranny ſyn agayn fre man whiche called chriſtian religion hath cauſe chaunge ſtate become bonde rather let euery man endeuoure yf occaſion ſerue embrace lyberty chaunge hys bondage yf maiſter diſpleaſure borne chriſtes name reiecte ſeruaunt let ſame ſeke newe maiſter yet diſpleaſure wt ſelfe becauſe maiſterles ſynce hath chriſte maiſter whoſe free ſeruaunt bee come bonde man ſyde borne fre borne agayne baptiſme let hym ſtate neither bee angrie pleaſſed hym ſelfe ſynce baptiſme become bonde ſeruaunt chriſt ſo ſondrye ſortes bondman made fre fremanne made bonde thentent eche ſhoulde ſobrietie beare theyr fortune fredome bondage ſuch thinges wherof chriſte hath maner regarde embrace better yf thou bondage oppreſſed thinke albeit thy maiſter hath vpon thy bodie certayne power authority yet thy ſoule delyuered ſynne chriſte warde fre yf thy fredom thyng make prowde remember thou bought chriſte bought ſmalle price thou haſte maiſter feare honoure beware thou phantaſie thou art fre mayſt lyue thy pleaſure anye man bonde farfurthe chriſte made fre yf hys maiſter commaunde hym doe vngodly ſeruice rather bounde gyue eare chriſte hys newe lorde maiſter hys olde whiche reaſon abuſe hath loſte tytle yet reaſon ſuche asye derely boughte ye ſeruauntes men chriſte price bloud hath made fre ſhoulde greuouſe maiſter oppreſſed fauer lybertie yf maye chriſtes ſeruice perfite libertie chriſtian manne ſhoulde ſerue heathen ſemeth vnmete thinge reaſon ſuche chriſtian maiſter ſeruauntes ſhoulde bee fauoured brother chyldren becauſe bothe haue one comon maiſter whome bothe one price redeamed yet leſte vnder coloure chriſtian religion ſtate comon weale bee diſquieted let euery manne ſuffer hys condicyon therein abyde ſo abyde meane ſeaſon remember goddes commaūdementes muſte bee ſet commaundementes menne obey youre maiſters yet ſo god therwith pleaſed whiche payed suche poyntes haue taught freedome bondage haue alſo place ſtate matrimonie ſingle lyfe vnder lawe matrimonie ſorte bound ſingle fre ſtate lyfe therfore menne muſte alwaye folowe whiche commodiouſe maye yf maye ſaye maye ſo deſyre libertie loue therof fall greater ieopardie concernyng virgin haue commaundement lorde yet geue counſell one hath obtayned mercye lorde faythful ſuppoſe therfore good preſent neceſſyte good man ſo art thou bounde vnto wy • e ſeke looſed art thou looſed wyfe ſeke wyfe • thou marye wyfe thou haſt ſynned lykewiſe yf virgin mary ſhe hath ſynned neuertheleſſe ſuch ſhal haue trouble theyr fleſhe fauoure thys ſaye brethrē tyme ſhorte remayneth haue wiues though thei none wepe though wept reioyce bee though reioyced bye though poſſeſſed vſe world though vſed faſhyon worlde goeth awaye would haue without care vnmaryed careth thynges belong lorde may pleaſe lorde hath maried wyfe careth thinges worlde • e maye pleaſe hys wyfe difference betwene virgin wyfe ſingle woman careth thinges lord ſhe maye holy body alſo ſpirite agayne ſhe maryed careth thynges pertain worlde ſhe may pleaſe huſbande thys ſpeake youre profyt tangle ſhare ye may folow honeſt comely ye maye cleaue vnto lorde without ſeparacyon man thinke vncomly hys virgin yf ſhe paſſethe tyme mariage yf ſo nede requyre let hym lyſteth ſynneth let coupled mariage neuertheleſſe purpoſeth ſurely hys herte hauyng nede hathe power ouer owne wyll hath ſo decreed hys hert wyll kepe hys virgyn doeth well ioyneth hys virgin mariage doeth well ioyneth hys virgyn mariage doeth better wyfe bounde mariage longe huſbande lyueth huſbande dye ſhe libertie marye whome ſhe wyll onely lorde ſhe happyer yf ſhe ſo abyde iudgement thynke verely haue ſpirite god therfore touching queſtion ye aſke whether chriſtian men ought marie daughter beyng virgin kepe home perpetuall virginitie halowed vnto chriſte ſame maye fredome doe hym ſeruice albeit herin haue commaundement god certainly aunſwere yet haue counſelle gyue ſuche thinke beſt thinke ye ſhould diſdayne counſell ſynce haue apoſtles authoritie whome alſo god goodnes hath gyuen albeit vnworthy euen wyll pleaſure gyue holſome faithfull coūſel regarding ſelf profitable nedeful expedient liberty ſake iudge thing bee wyſhed virgyn bynde ſelfe none chriſt becauſe thinke matrimonie honeſte holy kinde lyfe becauſe partly alyance partlie care bringyng vp chyldren ſtate full trouble carefulnes neceſſitie bondage eſcapeth abſtayneth mariage better therfore embrace thys libertie yf eyther thy power ieopardles ſuche already vnder bonde matrimonye theyr power ſuche lyue chaſte withoute daungier therfore yf thow alreadie bounde wife ſeeke vnder pretence chriſte bee diuorced yf thou bee free ſeke yoke matrimonye yf thou haue maried vpon miſtruſte thy ſtrengthe repent therof thou haſte ſo doinge ſynned thou haſte dede taken vpon carefull enterpriſe yet ſuche lawfull ſhalt thou therfore chriſte warde wurſe becauſe thou haſte wyfe thou ſhalt trouble morelykewyſe virgine marrye ſhe hathe • ſynned worldly care lykewyſe yf virgine haue rather mary gouerne houſholde none offence yf ſhe doe ſo damage none reaſon houſholde buſines ſhe leſſe fredome ſtudie ſcripture pray exerciſe godly matter while therfore geue wayes free lybertie fauer two maner wayes prouidyng lybertie whiche lyue without wedlocke remedie alſo ieopardie cannot lyue without commende ſingle lyfe ſtate commodiouſe approue matrimonie alſo hauyng leſſe ieopardie therfore herein euery manne doeth lette eche hymſelfe take hede neyther conſtrayne forbydde manne namely ſuche poyntes god neyther required yet forbade require brother generally ſynce tyme ſhorte foraſmuche laſte daye draweth nygh ye vttermoſte power make haſte obtayne ſuche thynges prepare agaynſte daye caſtyng awaye ſuche impedimentes myght lette haſtie iourney thytherwarde vncertayne daye ſhallbe certayne farre daye whoſo hath continuall remembraunce draweth nere ſhall frayle tranſitorie thynges lytle delyghted whether chaunce vnto hym eyther payne pleaſure laſte daye ſhall v take awaye bothe ye death alſo ſhall diſpatche bothe come daye ende bee ſuche thynges much troubled reioyce ſhall within ſhorte ſpace peryſhe heauenly matter hande let ſuch haue wyues let without regarde though none ſo ſhal bondage matrimonie leſſe trouble pleaſures wedlocke leſſe delyght let ſuche aduerſities oppreſſed wepe though wepte ſuche haue worldely welthe reioyce though thei reioyced let bye ſo bye thoughe thei poſſeſſed thing bought beyng ſuche ſhall ſhortly taken awaye whether thou wylt goe ſuch eyther chaunce neceſſitie entangled wyth worldely buſyneſſe let vſe theſame though vſed yf heauenly matter cannot onely bee regarded yet let regarded chiefly fyrſt al next theſe worldly affaire nothing hath world euen ſhadowes good thynges badde wherein nothyng eyther ſounde ſtable whereunto bee muche geuen purpoſe ſuche laboure lyfe immortall theſe thynges ſpeake thereforei would haue without care becauſe would haue troubled lytle might worldly matter folowe ſuch kinde life wherin ye like leaſte worldly buſyneſſe behalfe better ſtate ſingle maried ſingle troubled diuerſe care nether pleaſe father law pleaſe mother lawe aliaunce chriſt wordly trouble care ſhalbe able time withdraw theſame let euery man vprightly weigh himſelfe whether waye whiche ſeeth honorable free thinke ſame ieopardles ſuch diſpoſed vnto feareth leſte fall reproch infamie yf ouer long kepe daughter virgine home already mariage able mynded theſame matter ſelfe requireth leſſe good leaue geue doe ſhal thinke expedient done albeit ſayed matrimony haue bondage care adioyned yet without ſinne honeſt lawfull alſo ſome neceſſary let therfore father ſyght worlde ſeaſon prouyde daughter huſbande leſte ſhe ſtelth doe ſhamfully done matrimonie ſtandeth ſhall haue leyſure wholy without intermiſſion ſerue ſpouſe chriſte intent purpoſe none ſhould ſeke lybertie ſingle lyfe ſyght god cōmendable thyng ſtate matrimony beſtowe god ſeruice muche tyme lefte wydowes marry euery mā profitable belongeth particularly preſcribe apoynte herein let euery man hymſelfe take aduiſe may doen without offence declare virgine may lawfully marry becauſe ſhe free viii chapter texte▪ touchynge thynges offred vnto ymages ſure haue knowledge knowledge maketh man ſwell loue edifyeth man thynke knoweth thynge knoweth nothynge yet ought knowe yf man loue god ſame knowen hym concerning eating thoſe thinges offred vnto ydols ſure image nothing worlde none god one though called god whether heauen erath goddes many lordes many yet vnto v one god father thynges hym one lorde ieſus chriſte whome thynges hym touchyng queſtions concernyng matrimonie thynke ye ſufficiently aunſwered vnto becauſe ye ſhall hencefurthe vpon ſuche matter ſoundry opinion eche one nomore ſtriue becauſe know ye doubt whether lawfull chriſtian manne eate fleſh beaſt offered vnto idolles whiche fleſhe painyms take holy queſtion alſo mynde among becauſe know idole nothyng eyther tymber braſſe ſtone therfore fleſhe vnto offered dede nothyng differeth fleſhe mannes conſcience canne kynde meate bee defiled abuſyng theyr knowledge euery place without conſideracion engorge pamper vppe themſelues fleſh offered idolles iudgyng myſſe matter dede yet forgettyng lawe charitie whiche geueth maunne occaſion myſſe thynkyng ſlaundre confourmeth herſelfe ſuche weake vntyll lytle lytle growe vppe knowledge greate matter yf vnderſtande image hath godly power chriſtian manne vnderſtandeth whiche euen painyms vnderſtande yf bee thyng wyſer commen ſorte yet better oftetymes foloweknowledge maketh man ſwell loue edifieth rule charitie rule knowledge knowledge doeth oftetymes hurte beyng ſuche thyng maketh manne ſwell bee diſdaynfull endeuer charitie tyme place doe good hurte manne albeit dede ſuche ſeme lacke great parte knowledge alſo whiche knowe howe vſe theyr knowledge poynte teacheth charitie whiche meaſureth iudgeth thinges weale neyghbour therfore ſuch thinges doeth ſeme perfitly learned muſt call charitie councell without charitie ſwelleth vayne perſuaſion learned ſo far knowledge come ſo far knowe howe ſhould vſe knowledge godwarde wyſe theſame man wyſe man dede pleaſeth hymſelfe ſeketh owne glory without regarde brother ieopardie learning god alloweth vnfaynedly loueth god muſt alſo loue neighbour one therfore god acknowledgeth owne diſciple becauſe god humbled hygh godhead ſaue mankynde ſo doeth ſuche one ſubmitte knowledge compell ſerue commoditie neyghbour returne therfore purpoſed matter knowe maner albeit gentyles wurſhyp idoles though ſome diuine power godheadwe ſure image nothyng yet idole dede nothing el either piece tymber ſtone hathe nomore godhead vnſquared piece tymber vnwrought ſtone therfore fleſhe offered nomore goodnes hurte ſuche ſolde ſhambles ye ſee ſtone wrought vnto y• image man ſome beaſt ſince one god hath none image cannot coūterfaited el repreſent idol deuils miſerable people offer vnto ſtede god theſe men therfore defiled ſuche meates whiche receyue holy whereas bee vnholye prophane chriſtians ſuche fleſhe defileth whiche eate holye vſe creature made god apeaſe hunger vſe ſuſtenaunce deuocion hymſelf laughing folyſhe rable heathen goddes beeyng fullye perſwaded god one whome thynges holye albeit ſome whiche called goddes whether bee heauen whome call heauenlye el earth whome call goddes earthlye whiche ſorte manye goddes many lordes yet theſe name onely god lordes onely ſuche erroniouſly beleue ſo haue taken theyr goddes lordes v chriſtians onely one god ſaye father ieſus creatoure gouernour worlde whome receyue goodnes whome onely beyng addicte ought ſerue al honour reuerence haue alſo one lorde ieſus chriſte whome onely father hath geuen v thynges throughe whoſe onelye benefite confeſſe true god ſo falſe curſed heathen goddes haue nothyng whiche ſhoulde nomore eſtemed yf none ſuche dede whoſoeuer therfore chriſtian ſtrength nothyng paſſeth vpon ydole vpon whiche offered ſurely iudgeth well mighte without gilte eate fleſhe offered vnto aſwell meate ſo euery manne ſo perſwaded knewe trueth true dede woulde man offended texte euery man hath knowledge hauyng conſcience becauſe ymage vntyll houre eate thyng offered vnto ymages ſo theyr conſcience beyng weake defiled meate maketh acceptable god neither yf eate better neyther yf eate worſe take hede leſte meanes libertie occaſion fallyng weake yf ſome man ſe whiche haſte knowledge ſyt eate meate offred vnto ymages ſhal conſcience whiche weake boldened eate thoſe thynges whiche • fered ymages ſo thorowe thy knowledge ſhall weake brother peryſhe chriſt dyed ye ſynne ſo agaynſt brother wounde theyr weake conſcience ye ſynne agaynſte chriſt wherfore yf meate hurte brother wyll neuer eate fleſhe leſte ſhoulde offende brother nowe ſome ſytte feaſte whiche lawes theyr elder euen theyr chyldehode perſwaded throughlye grounded ydoll holy thyng thynke many ſitte one feaſte lyke ſuperſticion broughte mynde ſuche thynges ſhoulde ſo greatly deſpiſed whiche haue ſuche great reuerence wyll take thyng thou doeſt vpon right iudgement conſcience wyſe reaſonyng themſelues ſynce chriſtian menne ſomuche abhorre ſacrifices therein holde faſte moſes vayle ſee faythe caſtyng ſame thorowghe chriſte darkeneſſe lawe brogate stu • bernelye yet ſtycke theyr moſes cumme whome moſes bade geue eare hym reade theyr ſynagoges reade hym carnallye ſekyng nothyng corporall thynges wheras lawe menne well loke thereupon deede ſpiritual▪ letted thei doubteleſſe euen vntyll day wyth vayle caſt ouer theyr heartes remoued fayth goſpell tyme ſhall come ſhall leaue theyr groſſe myndes receauyng vniuerſall fayth tourne vnto lorde ſhall theyr vayle taken away ſo ſhall ſee ſuche thynges without bryght eye fayth ſeen▪ moſes groſſe carnall lorde ieſus ſpirite teachyng ſuche thynges maye bee ſeene oure bodyly iyes thynges inuiſible whiche fayth beleued moſes law becauſe feare puniſhemente kepte menne ordre lawe thraldome vayle alſo token bondage ſpirite lorde ieſus whiche ſecretelye moueth manne withoute byddyng compulſion lead • godlye lyfe libertie manne compelled beleue beleueth ſhoulde accorde auoydeth filthines vncleanes lyfe foloweth al goodneſſe dooyng wyllinglye mocion charitie coulde euer begotten iewes wyth feare puniſhemente blinde therefore lacke iyes faythe throughe pure fayth without vayle beholde glorye lorde whoſe brightnes while receyue glaſſe altered ſorte ſame glorye plentifully powring vpon brightnes receyued god moſes face talked god ſhyned euen glaſſe doothe layed againſte ſonne ſo oure ſoule euerye daye ſecr • atelye enamoured encreaſing glory glory reaſon continual conuerſacion ſpirite god inuiſiblye nowe woorkethe v whiche hereafter ſhal openlye bee accompliſhed fourth chapter texte ¶therefore ſeeyng haue ſuche office euen god hath hadde mercye v wee goe kynde haue caſte v clokes vnhoneſtie walke craftines neyther handle woorde god diſcreatefullye open trueth reporte ſelues euerye mannes conſcience ſighte god oure goſpell bee yet hydde hidde among loſte whome god worlde hath blinded mindes whiche beleue leſte light goſpell glorie chriſte whiche image god ſhoulde ſhyne vnto synce god mercy would haue v bee miniſters preacher ſuche bliſfull ſtate geuyng vnto v authoritie apoſtle execute oure commiſſion • louthfullye preache veraye gloriouſe matter ſo refuſe clokes whiche meete diſhoneſtie glorye neyther leadyng oure lyfe craftely deceitfulnes woorldely learning corruptyng woorde god frealy playnly without deceyte declaryng al men bare trouthe without cloud office ſo vſing ſelfes though manne prayſe v yet oure lyfe commendeth v menne whiche knowe witneſſe oure perfectnes onelye menne whiche maye bee deceyued alſo god whiche ſeethe thynges v therefore al place ſhyneth trueth goſpel ſo euerye man may ſee euedently yf ſome yet whome knowen therefore geueth ſaluacion faulte goſpels tolde iſraelites ſo haue likewyſe vayle caſte ouer eye theyr hearte reaſon wherof ſee ſuche thinges verye bright blynde middes ſonne light bryng vncleare iyen ſuche corrupte worldlye deſyres whoſe vnfaythfull myndes satan god worlde theyr god make hym whiche hym geue eare true god hathe blynded couering theyr iyes bryghtnes goſpell geue light whereby glory maieſtie declared moſes chriſte whiche image god father ſo ſonne egall father man maye knowe father texte preache oure excellency power myght god oures troubled euery iyde yet without ſhyfte pouerty▪ vtterly without ſomewhat ſuffer perſecucion forſaken therein caſt downe neuertheleſſe peryſhe wayes beare aboute body dying lorde ieſus lyfe ieſu myght alſo appeare body whiche •• ue alwayes delyuered vnto death ieſus ſake lyfe alſo ieſu might appeare mortal fleſh death worketh v lyfe auaunce oure ſelues preachyng ſome doe teachyng goſpell aduauntage glorie preache ieſus chriſte oure lorde doctrine teache hym labour oure lorde mayſter payne ſoeuer take ſo farre takyng anye thyng arrogātly vpon v graunt ſelues ſeruauntes miniſtre ghoſpell vnto neither feare yet hope auauntage ieſus ſake whoſe loue whereas free euen ſeruauntes ſubmitte ſelues men lyke ſorte ſame blyndnes wherewith ſome diſeaſed ſtil yet gotte light ſelues god whoſe commaundement lyght fyrſte made whome light procedeth expelled darknes oure vnderſtandyng commaunded lighte trueth ſhoulde appere rather lighte euerlaſtyng lightened oure hearte y• v glory maieſtie might ſpread abrode among mē beyng notified preachyng goſpel wherein preachebut haue trea • ure earthen veſſels lorde ieſus whoſe face moſte brightly ſhineth image glorie father yet greate matier onlye wrought ſoules ſecretely touchyng bodye ſeme vyle abiectes ſo • arie aboute v preciouſe highe treaſure earthen veſſels ſaye ſealye body ſubiecte vilanye puniſhment hathe pleaſed god ſhould good cauſe ſo pleaſed hym prouided y• ſhould proude great high myracles wroughte v whereby might clayme ſome parte therof know owne infirmitie ſo vnderſtande ſelfe ſame highe power whiche geuen apoſtles wrought ſtrengthe god power onely touchyng owne infirmitie dayly greatly troubled yet god help ſuffer al theſe trouble continue ouercomen euery ſyde ouerlayed aduerſitie yet withoute ſhifte brought beggery oure beggerye forſaken ſuffer perſecucion yet perſecucion diſmayed beaten downe tredden vnder feete yet ſo peryſhe behalfe folowyng lorde ieſus▪ nyghe maye whome preache ſetfoorth dyed men daylye continuallye ieopardie death beare aboute oure bodyes image deathe ready beſtowe lyfe ſakes dyeng folowe death ieſus ſo maye lyfe ieſus wherunto roſe deathe oure body declared whyles either hym delyuered deathe deſpiſing oure temporal lyfe playnly teſtifie affirme deade ſhall ryſe agayne yf beleued bodye dead woulde neuer lyue woulde ſo lytle regarde oure temporall lyfe thys ſtraunge waye therfore ye ſee howe euerlaſting lyfe chriſt affliccions corruptible body better knowen difference violent ieoperdy death falleth vpon oure body fruite lyfe groweth deathe whoſe ſakes put ſelues theſe ieopardyes texte ſeyng haue ſame ſpirite fayth accordyng wryttē beleued therfore ſpoken alſo beleue therfore ſpeake know rayſed vp lorde ieſus ſhall rayſe vp v alſo meanes ieſus ſhall ſet v thynges ſakes plenteous grace thanckes geuen many maye redounde prayſe god wherfore weryed though vtward man peryſhe yet inwarde man renewed daye daye ••• buiacyon momentany lyght prepareth exceadyng eternal waight glorye vnto v whyle loke thynges whiche ſene thynges whiche ſene thynges whiche ſeue temporall thynges whiche ſene eternall yet repente v preachyng goſpel ſince haue alſo euen ſame gifte faythe ye haue whereby ye loke life immortall preachyng powred heartes foloweth dauid miſticall pſalme ſayeth therfore ſpoke becauſe beleued ſo feare nothyng ieopardye oure lyfe preache trueth goſpell vndoubtedly aſſuryng ſelues whiche rayſed lorde ieſus death wyll throughe hym rayſe v agayne dying ſake bryng v together generall glorie reſurreccion lyke fayth knytte together whether meane ſeaſon troubled deliuered trouble done ſakes trueth goſpel maye ſpread abrode among amende theyr lyfe ſo manye geue thankes v god whoſe glorie appertayneth faithe would haue cōmen men moſte plentifully enlarged hope ſure cō fidence ſo trouble werye v rather ware ſtronger knowing wel albeit oure vtwarde body litle litle worne awaye yet inwarde better parte dayely continuall decaye body becometh quicke ſuſtie miſeries growyng yong agayne beginnyng taſte lyfe euerlaſtyng come albeit bodely affliction whiche goſpelles ſake abyde lyght tranſitory yet lyght prepareth v ſmall exceadyng vnſpeakable weight glory whyles ſuche tranſitory tormentes ſuffered chriſtes ſake made worthy blyſſe euerlaſtyng temporall deathe ſuſtayned hym receaue rewarde euerlaſtyng lyfe hope wherof lytle eſteme oure bodyly lyfe ſomuche paſſing vpon ſuche thynges ſeene owre bodylye eye vpon ſuche ſeene eye faythe ſuche thinges ſene world beſide thinges neither throughly good throughly bad whiche ſorte lucre honoure pleaſure lyfe loſſe godes reproche tormentes deathe alſo continuallye abydyng whereas ſuche thinges ſene eye faythe bothe trewe ryches ſuche wyll endure euer v chapiter texte knowe yf oute earthly manſyon thys dwellyng deſtroyed haue byldyng god habitacyon made handes eternall heauen therfore ſygh deſyryng bee clothed oure manſyon whiche heauen ſo yet yf founde clothed naked thys tabernacie ſygh greued becauſe would vnclothed would clothed vpon mortalitie myght ſwalowed vp lyfe hath ordeyned v thys thynge god whiche ſame hathe geuen vnto v erneſte ſpirite vpon thys ſure truſte certaynly lytle regarde euen oure lyfe knowinge well yf chaunce ſoules worlde chaced manſion oure bodye whiche myght properly call tent manſion ſuche manne maye long tary though nomanne dryue hym thence haue prepared v another howſe heauen whence ſhall neuer excluded howſe oures becauſe made claye buylded manne whether wyll decayeth dayly albeit man pull downe euen ſee buyldynges continuaunce tyme deſtroyed mennes workmanſhyp longe continuaunce whiche repayred god becomen heauenly ſuche ieoperdies chaunce reaſon tyme ſo lytle feare departe wretched body vntyl ſygh deſyring diſcharged burdayne mortal carkas wherewith ſoule earth much burdeyned kept downe deſyrouſe flye hence another place clothed manſion gloryfied body ſhall heauen gyuen vnto v ſo bee vnclothed bodye bee founde vtterlye naked confidence good lyfe clothed hope lyfe immortall grone thys meane ſeaſon heuynes oure bodye thrall ſubiecte ſo manye miſeries becauſe thyng ſelfe bee deſyred man departe hence becauſe deſyre haue bodye reſtored better fourme mortalitie ryſyng againe receaue immortalitie ſo ſeme vtterly ſpoyled bodye whiche tyme forſoke better clothed ſame corruptible bodye ſhall receaue incorruptible albeit ſeme neuer ſo vnlikely ſhall mortall body ryſe immortall fre miſeries yet muſte miſtruſte ſonne god whiche hathe prepared v receaue glory lyfe immortall hathe alſo reproue thinke fault rather layd certain falſe apoſtles whiche beyng rather preacher moſes chriſt abuſe rudenes trouble title high apoſtles manacyng threatenyng though ſo ſtode ye could without circumciſion attaine vnto ſaluacion ſo doyng onely laboryng renue ceremony olde lawe whō meete abrogate aboliſhed vnder colour alſo vtterly peruertyng goſpel chriſt ſynce ſame goſpel fayth godly life aſſureth al men embrace perfite weale ſaluacion well may coumpted vayne deceiptful doctrine teache man haue entrey euerlaſtyng welth vnleſſe circumciſed cuſtome moſes lawe requireth god defende mannes authoritie ſhould remoue frō purenes ſinceritie goſpel texte neuertheles though ſelues angel frō heauē preache goſpel vnto whiche haue preached vnto let acurſed ſayd ſo ſaye nowe againe man preache goſpell ye haue receiued let accurſed rather ſo farre frō beyng moued name peter iames ihon y• ſame neuer ſo great whiche name men abuſe bring vnder burdaine lawe euen angel ſent frō heauen preache vnto goſpel preached let ſame onely heard alſo taken one abhorred accurſed leſt thynke theſe wordes ſpoken either haſtynes vnpacience reherſe thē whoſoeuer whether angel apoſtle high name preache vnto otherwyſe ye haue learned v accurſed ſaye abhominable texte perſuade men god either go aboute pleaſe menne hitherto ſtudied pleaſe men ſeruaunt chriſt often men hand wt right line chriſtes fayth neither man authoritie angel ought preuail take place ſo preacheth chriſtes goſpel laboreth man buſynes godseither go aboute pleaſe men ſo ſhould feare man authoritie man god put truſt preache y• goſpel whiche office pray whether ſhould ſuche wyſe hādle ſelfe pleaſe men god whō onely acknowledge author maiſter iewes vpon worldly zeale labor ſet furth among al men theyr rite ceremony thentent may vnder coloure made nature men would haue euer ſuche way ſeme beſt wherin ſelfes brought vp wherfore ſome ſekyng haue iewes fauor labor bryng men minde circumciſed preache kepyng ſabboth day wt obſeruyng difference meates though ſo reache taught men high ſingular point god forbid yt ſhould ſo farfoorth labor pleaſe iewes beyng rather carnal ſpiritual ſhould ſuffre wt iewiſhe ceremony ye puritie goſpel corrupted tyme paſt geuen iewiſhenes pleaſed countreymen wayes could perſewyng profeſſed name chriſt while went pleaſe men diſpleaſed god would haue moſes aboliſhed glory ſonne chriſt ſet foorth long bonde lawe al myne entent andfor hitherto ſtudied pleaſe men c endeuoure kepe moſes rule ſought praiſe men handes hath god called way whoſe onely praiſe deſyre loke ſhould hence foorth ſtyl loke ſame praiſe menne certainly chriſtes ſeruaunt man thinke ſeruaūt apply ſelfe winne fauor men thā cōmaundemētes feare diſpleaſe ye iewes god father chriſt author ye goſpel neuer ſlauiſhely bonde ceremony moſes lawe whō well wyſt light chriſtes goſpel quite aboliſhed ſuche tyme wholy geuen ſelfe chriſt albeit twyſe appeaſyng commocion whiche might elswyſe haue beyng among nowe matier gone ſo ferre ſtycke charge ye burden lawe thing neceſſarie euen goſpell founde free burden thynke hyghe tyme freely playnly ſpeake agayne moſes rite openly deteſte maketh derogacion brother goſpell whiche taught ſuche worldly ordinaunce maye mannes pleaſure altered maye whiche made man suche preache circumciſion let theyr parte take hede whence learned theyr goſpell surely commaundement immediatly commuted vnto furthwith ſoone perceyued myne errour receyued heauen commiſſion without delaye went arabia nothyng doubted preache chriſtes name beyng yet wylde harbarouſe people either vnknowen hated leſſe zeale preachyng grace goſpel exſte preached moſes lawe arabia retourned damaſco ſtreyght frō baptiſme begun profeſſe chriſtes name texte thre yeares retourned ioye fayth reioyſyng maye aboundant thorow ieſus chriſte commyng agayne intent ye may amplye partaker ioye would ye ſhould vnderſtand brethrē y• empriſonmēt fetter arraignemētes calamity wher wt toſſed turmoyled ye goſpel chriſt hinder ye ſitting abrod cōfirming ye doctrine goſpel alſo happened great furtheraunce withdraw faythfull frō profeſſion y• taken vpon thē alſo confirmed thē greate deale ye made thē hartie better courage ſo vnderſtode y• moſt vndoubtedly true y• preache y• afraied ſuffre theſe thinges made thē bold entrepriſe y• lyke myne exāple ye moſt part cōmen chaūce yt happeneth matter honeſtye weightye importaūce holden vnder turmoyled hereawaye thereawaye ſo muche come forwarde appeare withſtāding ye endeuour ye wicked trauailling cōtrarie dede bondes gaue occaſion woorde chriſte came onelye fewe thoſe ſymple ſorte commune people afore floryſhed alſo throughoute neroes hall whole cytie ſo ſondrye brother whyche profeſſed ghoſpell tyme men halfe afrayed nowe beynge encouraged wyth bondes lorde ieſus ordreth matter begynne alid myne example profeſſe woorde ghoſpell freely boldelye drede ſet aparte albeit men dyd wyth lyke ſynceritie dyd alſo wyth lyke dylygence yet matter chaunced occaſion furtheraunce ghoſpell among ſome dyd maliciouſe purpoſe procure greater hatred againſt kyndle neroes ſtomake ſo muche fearcely agaynſte v ſawe thys ſecte encreaſe come forwarde whiche erronious conceipte iudgeth hurtefull empire conſideration whereof thoughte woulde ſoner haue diſpatched oute waye perchaunce manye hauynge diſdeigne glorye whyche notwythſtandynge chalenge ſelfe reſigne whollye vnto chriſte haue gone aboute throughe malicious enuye obſcure commendacion myght ſeme diligente wee agayne preache chriſte dooe ſyncere good conſcience thoughe throughly perfite concernynge fauoure outwarde maner man wante anye theyr handes whyche loue ſee endaungered thys cauſe goe ſtedfaſtlye accordyng offyce commytted vnto defende ghoſpell agaynſte wycked althoughe euen thoſe preache vpon moſte naughty purpoſe haue furthered glorye ghoſpell alſo preache chriſte chriſtian conſcience vpryghte purpoſe labour intente myghte cauſe nowe taken bounden greuouſlye punyſhed caſe throughe theyr earneſt hoote cockled ghoſpellyng coulde haue broughte v haynous diſpleaſure thys ſo euer ſhal happen vnto ſhall make great matter ſo turne glorye chriſte vnto whome owe ſuche entier hartie loue glad haue hym notified vnto men occaſion ſo euer deſerue greateſt commendation god preache chriſte vpon ſame intente doe borne wythall vpon certayne pryuate affection towardes v ſet forwarde doctrine goſpel thoſe y• preache chriſt diſpleaſure y• hurte thēſelues ſorye y• goe hurt defye thē froward purpoſe turneth furtheraunce ye goſpel veray glad ſo teache chriſte truelye althoughe theyr entent nothyng vpryght doo onelye reioyce nowe preſentlye alſo wyll reioyce hereafter raſe goe ſtyl deſpight ſet doctrine chriſt greueth intente thys meanes deſtroye ſeynge knowe well ynoughe wyth helpe youre prayer ſpirite ieſu chriſte forwardynge gouernyng buſines ſhall proue vnto beſt commoditie whether dye lyue faythfull truſte haue cōceyued hym ſhall neuer deſceaue whiche moſte certaynly perſwaded wil neuer leaue deſtitute put ſhame preaching goſpell hathe cōmytted vnto ſo ſhal enforced wyth anye affliction either • ante vayne holde tongue ſpeakyng thyng ſure mooſte true rather lyke affliction whiche haue ſuffered mennes handes bodye haue alwayes hetherto turned aduauntage ghoſpell eyther whan ſtoned whan ſcourged wyth whyppes whan caſte wylde beaſtes euen ſo thys afflyction whereby ieoperdye heade lyfe ſhall proue alſo glorye prayſe chriſte whether chaunce lyue dye former ſtormes myne affliction althoughe troubled thys ca • ca dyd neuer wythdrawe myne harte made ſhrynke ſtedfaſt preachyng chriſte ſhall alſo thys hoote tempeſt thyng withdrawe yf lyue ſhall defende trueth ghoſpell boldely yf ſhall dye euen deathe whiche ſhall gladlye ſuffer ghoſpelles ſake ſhall glorye chriſt whether waye ſo euer happeneth vnto ſhalbe ſure ſauegarde death onely afrayed thynke alſo rather wyſhed yf myghte ſpedye furtheraunce ghoſpell yet wearye lyue thoughe lyue thys payefull eſtate meaſure felicitie lyfe ſucceſſe ghoſpell parte affrayed death ſhalbe vauntage brynge ioyes heauen thys lyfe ſhall truely lyue yet meane tyme thys vyle corporall lyfe wanteth frute foraſmuche amplyfyinge good dedes rewarde immortalitie amplyfyed alſo beſydes whyle lyue thys worlde ghoſpell chriſte ſet forwarde confirmed throughe oure trauayll hande chriſte whether hys pleaſure rather lyue dye myne owne parte ſo readyly prepared eyther waye tell whether better choſe cauſe ſhoulde wyſhe dye cauſe ſhoulde refuſe lyue whan haue caſt beſt me▪ examyned myne owne hearte perceyue greate deale better loſed frome troublous toylynges thys lyfe preſente companye wyth chriſte goe agayne vnto vnſpeakeable felicitie taſte whan • apte thyrde heauen agayne whan conſider beſt moſte expedyent perceyue profitable yea rather neceſſarie contynue yet whyle thys myne office knowe certayntie ſhall tarye ſtyll yet life tarye ſo ſhall haue youre companye agayne ſuche libertie ſhall goe forwarde aboundauntlye faithe ſhall haue muche cauſe glad encreace fayth parte maye glad commyng vnto agayne whan ſhall ſee helpe chriſte haue onely geuen place theſe myſcheuous trouble alſo preſerued encreaſe beſt profite texte onely let conuerſacion becommeth goſpel chriſt whether come ſee el abſent may yet condicion ye continue one ſpirite one ſoule labourynge doo mayntayne faythe ghoſpel nothyng fearynge aduerſaries whiche cauſe perdicion ſaluacion god vnto geuen chriſte onlye ye ſhoulde beleue hym alſo ye ſhoulde ſuffre hys ſake hauynge euen ſuche ſight ye ſawe nowe heare doo ſee nowe howe lytle regarde myne owne feli • itie compariſon youre commoditie man woulde loothe care thys worlde thyrde heauen woulde deſire vpper paradiſe delyuered theſe miſeries woulde contemne communication man whan remembreth ſecrete wordes ſpoken aboue would ſtedde ſo many daungiers ſo mani ieoperdies ſo many deathes rather choſe quietneſſe neuer ſhall haue deathe neuertheles ſet ſo muche brotherlye charitie regarde profyte others myne owne deſyre therefore ſhalbe youre partes applye youre ſelues diligentlye maye doo lykewyſe accordynge mynde thys behalfe ſhalbe caſe wyl frame lyfe anſwerably vnto ghoſpell chriſte whoſe ſake abyde theſe trouble fruſtrate frute whiche onelye thyng woulde wyſhe ſeperated moſte bleſſed felowſhyppe chriſte therefore endeuoure youre ſelues caſe ſee agayne maye fynde ſuche woulde wyſhe yf anye let ſee agayne yet leaſt maye myne abſence lyke haue done alwayes hitherto ſo continue ſtyll one ſpirite whiche haue commonlye receyued agree one mynde holdyng vp wyth diligence prayer fayth ghoſpell warreth agaynſte wycked afrayed perſecution reſiſte enemy chriſte manfullye euery place whoſe wycked doynges aduerſaries howbeit wyſe attribute oure ſelues geuen god onelye beleue ghoſpell chriſt wythout dyſſemblyng preache alſo readyly ſuffer ſee doe ſhrynke abyde ſame conflicte ghoſpelles ſake haue ſene free remiſſiō ſinnes death ſōne ye ſhoulde hencefurthe liue ſubiect ſin innocent vprighte life make haſte forwarde life ſhall neuer haue ende thākes ſhould god father haue ſuche thinges whiche rather becauſe ye without grace god lyfe mannes ſoule ye ſpiritually deade texte ye ye dead ſynne vncircumciſion youre fleſhe hathe quickened hym hath forgyuen v oure treſpaces hath put hande wrytyng agaynſt v contayned lawe wryten hathe taken oute waye hath faſtened croſſe hath ſpoyled rule power hath made ſhewe openly hath triumphed ouer owne perſone kynde vncircumciſion ſaye ſortes v comen whiche god hath holy ſpirite cutte taken away forgeuing v oure ſynnes ſuche ſorte forgyuyng oute ieopardie hauyng ſame offence hereafter layed vnto oure charge becauſe haue aduiſedly ſworne obediēt moſes lawe breache wherof oure aduerſary deuyll myght haue action agaynſte v agaynſt men bounden theyr owne hande wrytingand hath put handwryting againſt v c yea olde obligacion ryght wherof deuyll ſued v hath chriſte raſed oute aſſone profeſſed fayth goſpell whome offence olde lyfe forgyuen ſo • ame layed mannes charge whatſoeuer myght v ryghte wrytyng requyred ſame hath chriſte ſakes payed vpon croſſe wrytyng rente torne vtterly cancelled haue nowe anye cauſe feare tyrannye satan ſynce chriſte hath croſſe death vanquyſhed authour death thereby deliuered v triumphantly ſubduyng power rule deuylles carying v heauenlye kyngdome thoughe bene ryche price botye declared freely playnly ouercō men vnharnyſed ſight bothe men aungels caryed v triumphe ſhewyng enemyes ſubdued put flyght man al workes deſyres put new mā whiche wyl neuer olde reaſon knowledge god dayly encreaſeth floriſheth buddeth vpand image made better greater image chriſt beyng new mā ſelfe builded v new man among child while ye chriſtes ſake ſeruice vnmete maiſters ye ſerue chriſt texte doeth ſynne ſhal receiue ſinne neither reſpecte perſons god maiſter yf againſt ſeruaūt thing offende though among men ſuffer cherefull texte epaphras ſeruaunte chriſte one ſaluteth alwayes laboureth feruently prayer ye maye ſtande perfite ful al wil god beare hym recorde hath feruēt mynde laodicia hierapolis epaphras greeteth whiche one profeſſion chriſtes name alſo one ſame countrey ſo hartelye fauoreth moſte feruently maketh prayer god y• ye helpe maye ſtedfaſtly continew ye haue begunne vnperfit chriſtiās al ſuche thinges god requireth perfite full beare hym recorde hath feruent loue towarde toward onely alſo towarde laodicia hierapolis whiche border nigh vnto texte deare lucas phyſicion greteth demas salute brother whiche laodicia ſalute nymphas congregacion whiche houſe lucas phyſicion whō ſingulerly loue greteth ſo doth alſo demas whiche yet salute aſwell brother laodicia alſo holy pure vncleane thoſe maner vayne ſmokes blowen vnto people ſuche occupye chriſtes buſines vnfaythfully yea rather go gayne ſee thou auoyde ſuche maner tryfles teache brother thoſe thinges thou haſt learned playe good vpryght miniſtre chriſte diſpoſing entierly faythfully doctrine ferre dyfferent frō theſe mennes preſcribed appoyntementes thus ſtandeth hande doo ſo muche rather bycauſe thou art called teacher ghoſpel yet full growen age whiche wonte eaſylye ſwerue newe fangles thou haſt ben brought vp euen thy youth fayth ghoſpell good learnyng ſo thy contynuaunce ought make practiced ſtrong thou canſt choſe lyke thy ſelfe thyng thou haſt hitherto conſtauntly folowed therefore ſee thou teache thys doctrine worthy ghoſpell vnto thoſe thyne mennes fable vayne olde wyues tale god whome heauens ſhal periſſhe fyre elementes ſhall melt heare neuertheles accordynge promes loke newe heauen new earth wherin dwelleth righteweſnes wherfore dearly beloued ſeyng ye loke ſuche thinges diligent ye maye foūde peace without ſpotte vndefyled ſuppoſe longe ſufferynge lorde faluacion euen dearely beloued brother paule alſo accordinge wyſedome geuen vnto hath wrytten vnto yea almooſt euery epiſtle ſpeaking ſuche thinges amonge whiche many thinges harde vnderſtande whiche vniearned vnſtable peruert alſo ſcriptures vnto owne deſtruccion ye therfore beloued ſeyng ye warned beloued brother haue ſo fearfull iudgemēt alwayes eye geue dilygence whan lorde commeth maye fynde pure vnblameable onely menne whoſe iudgemētes many tymes deceaued alſo hi pure dede pure iudgement god althoughe paraduenture long ere daye come conſtrue ſo thoughe woulde come conſydre tender ſufferaunce lorde wherwith geueth men ſpace repent doeth care mennes ſaluacion whiche matter mooſte deare brother folowe office paule wrote vnto ſo muche habundantly god gaue plenteous gyfte wyſedome almoſt epiſtles exhorteth loke daye ſometyme ſpeakinge ſuche ſorte though daye lorde already hande might rather prycke forwarde ſtudye godlynes daye becauſe vncertaine oughte loked ſo thoughe woulde come daye yet ſuche wyſe man preſcribe tyme certaine theſe ſome matter paule according high wiſedom myngled epiſtles wheras ſpake moſt rightly coulde yet ignoraunt inconſtaunt perſons wreſt peruerſe interpretacion doe ſcriptures owne deſtruccion thing whiche healthe vnto good maye turned throughe owne faulte venome vnto therfore brother ſence ſo many way warned hande bothe paule take hede deceyued fraude abominable men fall awaye ſubſtaunciall ſtedfaſtnes whiche haue expreſſed yet hitherto rather geue diligence maye continually encreaſe goe forewarde giftes knowledge lorde ſauiour ieſu chriſte vnto whome glorye bothe lyfe euer worlde without ende amen thus endeth paraphraſe vpon ſeconde hath profeſſed chriſte pretence religion goeth aboute ſubuert religiō deſperate frowardnes ſuche one deſerueth prayer godly menne yet perfite charitie prayeth alſo ſuche wyſhynge thoſe thynges cannot worldes enchauntmentes ſonne god hathe delyuered v whiche came worlde thys cauſe exempte v contagious infeccion worlde hathe dryuen awaye darkenes oure former ignoraunce hathe geuen v vnderſtandyng mutuall loue one another wonderfully glad whan perceaued thy ſonnes folowing theyr mother godlynes contynued ſtill truthe goſpelles doctrine gaue herkenynge vnto falſe doctours goe turne many awaye begynninge ſhoulde loue eche one mutual true chriſtian loue beneuolence conſent one facion godly life amonge oure ſelues muſt procure may lyue one purpoſed ſtudies commaundement god enioined v nothing ſo diligētly mutual loue amonge oure ſelues true loue amonge wiked among vnlike facions therfore geue new commaundement geue warninge diligently continue ſtill haue already receaued longe goe ſuffre youre ſelues ſubtilties falſe prophetes plucked awaye dede manye deceauers worlde whiche denye ieſus chriſte whiche ſhoulde come worlde accordinge prophetes prophecienges teacheth thus deceauer antichriſte ſelf chriſtes aduerſarie let euery one take hede hym ſelfe leſte forſake whiche hathe well begonne loſe frute thoſe thinges whiche hathe hitherto done well let v geue diligence may receaue full hyre happeneth perſeuer ſtill vnto theende whoſoeuer ſwarueth trueth abydeth ſtill doctrine chriſte eſtraunged alſo god father ſwarued ſonne conſtauntly foloweth doctrine ſo doinge dearely veritie ought onely take hede vnto alſo ought ſo muche admitted houſe deſyre lodging bidden god ſpede chaūce mete way daunger leſt infecte houſehold familiaritie hys lodging requite euill turne leſt bidding god ſpede ariſe communicacion dede euil communicaciō corrupteth good maners ſhorte ſaluteth kepeth company ſuch maner deceauour ſemeth companyon euill dooinges geueth courage vnto wicked whan ſeeth ſelfe whit regarded whome goeth ſubuerte geueth outwarde ſhewe euill vnto though ſemed fauour naughtynes hym whoſe familyaritie doeth abhorre many thinges whiche deſyrous wryte vnto concerning theſe matter howbeit rather open preſentlye put wryting truſte ſhortly come ſee talke preſently mouth mouthe ioy whiche haue conceaued youre conſtaunt ſynceritie maye bee pleynteous full whan ſhall forbiddeth woulde thruſteth oute congregacion beloued folowe whiche euyll good doeth well god doth euyll ſeeth god demetrius hath good reporte men trueth ſelfe yea oure ſelues alſo beare recorde ye ſpede haue conceaued ſmall pleaſure ſaying brother whiche come vnto v haue made reporte thy ſynceritie beinge true witneſſe bearours thou truly foloweſt trueth goſpell onely profeſſion alſo thy ſtudies thy whole life matter maketh harte glad chaunce heare childrē begat goſpell vnto chriſt doe folow trueth delyuered dearly beloued thou art diligentlye good vnto chriſtians whiche come thider ſtraungers thou dooeſt dede worthy hym truly putteth truſt goſpel loueth chriſt haue made reporte thy ſynceritie whole companye chriſtians thou ſhouldeſt doe well thou wouldeſt bring thoſe whome thou receiuedeſt gently cōming forth like gentilnes thither would goe like goe god buſines theyr owne deſerue entreated thē loue god hartily thei went forth market encreaſe theyr owne houſehold pelfe
